alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 1:09PM MST until January 18 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, moderate to heavy snow showers and areas of blowing and drifting snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of Laramie County in Wyoming. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 PM this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 10 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...For the Winter Weather Advisory, hazardous travel conditions possible. Falling and drifting snow may result in pockets of slick road conditions. Visibilities may be reduced to under one half mile at times. For the Wind Chill Advisory, the cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County
